reviews.review_msg: The only problem was her marking - class average of 70% for the first two tests! The class didn't get their marks back for the assignments until the night before the final exam. It may just be because it was her first semester at Dal, but overall I would say she gives great lectures and is caring, but this isn't the class to take to boost your GPA.
Good feedback and high interest in course materials
Very energetic!!
Great TA, amazing person and extremely helpful when help is needed! WOULD RECOMMEND

Best TA I had this semester!! Daniella's very friendly and kind. She's passionate about the course material and really cared about all her students. She was also very helpful and very easy to approach. And she responds to emails fairly quickly.

Best TA I had this semester!! Daniella's very friendly and kind. She's passionate about the course material and really cared about all her students. She was also very helpful and very easy to approach. And she responded to emails fairly quickly.
Awesome TA! She was very passionate about the course material and loved teaching all her students. She was also very helpful and very easy to to approach.

One of the better TA's you're likely to find, no matter the discipline.  Very passionate about the course material, despite it's being technical and thick.  Great sense of humour.  Honest (and thus tough) marker!  But at the same time gracious if you have extenuating circumstances and need extensions.  Highly recommended!
Extremely harsh grader, but overall a good TA. She's really friendly and easy to talk to. She actually cares about her students which is nice :b

Daniella is the best T.A I had this semester hands down. I was kind of scared because this is my first semester at SFU but Daniella proved to be super helpful and my fears turned out to be very unfounded. I'll give her a 100% anytime, anyday!
Awesome TA.

Daniella is by far the best TA I've had at SFU. She is super helpful, always taking time out of her day to make sure all of your questions are answered, whether in office hours, tutorial, or by email. On top of all that, she is super sweet and caring.
Awesome Ta!

Daniella is a remarkable TA. She answers your emails right away and is always available for help. She goes the extra mile to make sure you understand the material, and makes labs fun. I would recommend signing up for a tutorial with her.

Glad to have her as a t.a for a course like psych 300, was always positive and cheery, made my mornings better. She was approachable which was helpful since the prof wasn't. She took the initiative to plan activities in tutorials. Overall great t.a

She was very enthusiastic, here tutorials were always interactive, she would take the extra initiative to plan activities that we could do in tutorials. Very fast in responding to emails, glad to have her as a T.A since she was approachable unlike our professor.
Very responsive, goes above and beyond to help you in any way.

Daniella was very helpful. She was enthusiastic, interested, engaged, helpful, warm, welcoming, empathetic, and kind. The class itself was also interesting - listening to differing student viewpoints on a weekly topic really opened up my way of thinking. The tutorial was good, but I feel like it could have either had more put into it, or shortened.

The class was terrible, but she was helpful. Tried her best to make thins clear when expectations were very vague. Hard marker and not a lot of clear feedback. Go to office hours b/c written feedback isn't very specific. Very cheerful and did her best in a challenging class w difficult prof, but hard to do well and not very constuctive feedback.

Awesome T.A. Fun and approachable :) Friendly, and very organized. Takes feedback from students seriously, and explains everything in a simplistic way, easy to understand. Her teaching style is excellent - interactive!

Excellent TA for a somewhat difficult course. Very helpful and accessible. Prompt to reply to emails and always available for office hours, providing excellent feedback on assignments. Best TA I have had to date!
Very helpful and cheerful. Always available for office hours
Extremely helpful, cheerful and shows interest in course material. Easy to get along with and she insists on helping!
Went out of her way to help. Would spend hours, emailing and meeting with you to be sure that you understood everything.

Extremely helpful.  Goes out of her way to make tutorials interesting and exciting.  Always on hand to give advice, and would schedule advising times outside of office hours.  Overall, an enthusiastic, fun and professional individual.
Helpful, clear, and friendly. :)
She takes extra time and makes an extra effort to help students.
